questions.question: 1. Which of the following statements regarding IR spectroscopy is correct?

answers.a: IR radiation is higher in energy than UV radiation
answers.b: IR spectra records the scattering of the radiation
answers.c: IR spectra gives information about the ƛ<sub>max</sub> of the molecule
answers.d: IR radiation is higher in wavelength than UV radiation

explanations.a: IR radiation has lower frequency than UV due to which IR has lower energy than UV.
explanations.b: Scattering is not recorded by IR but X-ray scattering.
explanations.c: ƛ<sub>max</sub> is a property of UV spectra.
explanations.d: IR radiations are higher in wavelength than UV.

questions.question: 2. What is the condition for a molecule to be Microwave active?

explanations.a: microwave spectroscopy arises due to rotation of the molecule, rotation alone cannot produce any change in the dipole moment.
explanations.b: change of  polarisability does not affect the microwave interaction of the molecule.
explanations.c: all molecules which have permanent dipole moment are microwave active.
explanations.d: isotopic labelling does not qualify for a molecule to be Microwave active as labelling is done to identify a specific atom or reaction.

answers.a: NMR signals towards the left of the spectrum correspond to low chemical shift values.
answers.b: NMR signals towards the right of the spectrum correspond to high chemical shift values
answers.c: Chemical shift values are larger when shielding effects are greater
answers.d: Chemical shift values are larger when deshielding effects are greater

explanations.a: NMR signals towards the left of the spectrum correspond to high chemical shift values.
explanations.b: NMR signals towards the right of the spectrum correspond to low chemical shift values
explanations.c: Chemical shift values are smaller when shielding effects are greater i.e. the values are closer to 0.
explanations.d: Chemical shift values are larger when deshielding effects are greater i.e. the values are farther away from 0.

questions.question: 4. The absorption intensity on an absorption spectrum tells us:

answers.a: energy associated with a particular excitation.
answers.c: the concentration of the absorbing part of the molecule.
answers.d: both the ease of transition and the concentration of the absorbing part of the molecule.

explanations.a: energy of transition is given by the position of the signal and not its intensity.
explanations.b: ease of transition does affect the intensity but only to some extent.
explanations.c: absorption intensity depends on the concentration of the absorbing part of the molecule.
explanations.d: absorption intensity depends more on the concentration.
